name: YasuLab Inc.
tagline: Distributed Company that Works Remotely, focusing on Ruby/Rails Web Development, Translation, and Education.
body:
Main Works and Contribution
===========================

- Web sites/services, applications, and books:
   - [Rails Tutorial in Japanese](http://railstutorial.jp), one of most famous Rails books in Japan.
   - [Lexues Academy](http://academy.lexues.co.jp/), project-based learning course in Okinawa, Japan.
   - [Snapwhim](http://www.snapwhim.com/), Visual Bucket List.
   - [ScreenX TV](http://screenx.tv/), Real-time Terminal Broadcasting Tools.
   - [Whistle on Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.sorarier.whistle), Android app developed for [2011 T≈çhoku earthquake and tsunami](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2011_T%C5%8Dhoku_earthquake_and_tsunami).
- Open-source Communities:
   - [Okinawa.rb](https://www.facebook.com/groups/okinawarb/): [Okinawa Ruby User Group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/okinawarb/) that we found and maintain.
   - [CoderDojo Japan](http://coderdojo.jp/): Open-source Programming Clubs for Kids in Japan that we support.
   - [OpenSource Cafe](http://osscafe.net/): Open-source Cafe in Japan that we attend.

## About us

- See this [single static page](https://gist.github.com/yasulab/8970527) for knowing us. (only in Japanese for now)

## TIPS

This website is also published under MIT License. See [this repository](htttps://github.com/yasulab-inc/yasulab-inc.github.io) in GitHub if you're interested.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
